results.description:
This is a group for 20 and 30 something young women professionals in Astoria who are interested in meeting new friends and doing fun social activities together. Whether you are new to Astoria or enjoy social events, this group is for you! I like to plan happy hours, networking events, girls night out, volunteer events, fitness activities, etc. I'm open to new ideas and new experiences, so suggestions are. We set guidelines for the group , concerning cancellations and lateness. This is just to ensure the respect for other members and the chance for everyone to be involved since we have long waiting lists for our events . 1. RSVP
Only RSVP if you are sure you can make it . We understand things may come up , but we require you to change the RSVP at least 3 hours before the event . Once is fine , but if it is 3 times or more on a constant basis we have to remove you from the group .
2. Lateness
Please try your best to be on time , due to train and traffic delays it's ok to be up to 30 minutes late unless it's a sit down restaurant . ( brunch or dinner) . If you are more than 30 minutes late to an event more than 3 times you will be removed from the group . If you get bumped up from the waiting list last minute or an hour before the event we of course will not hold that against you . We understand you may have other plans by then. Again these new guidelines are in place for all fairness to everyone .
results.name: Astoria 20s and 30s Girlfriends Meetup

results.description:
This is a peer-run support/self-help group for those with Social Anxiety Disorder or extreme shyness. We exist to help those with social anxiety to participate fully in their lives. Our philosophy is that it's important to develop your goals and dreams and be guided by them, and not by your social anxiety. Our group is safe. Since you must have SAD to join (this does not need to be formally diagnosed), everyone has similar challenges and will understand and not judge you.  We meet weekly; the time and day of the week varies depending on location. We have a structured format which is based on therapeutic methods, research, and strategies that have worked for other people. We strive to be goal-focused and set goals based on fear hierarchies that are personalized to our values and goals in life.  This is an opportunity to practice socially anxious situations in a safe environment, in a no-pressure atmosphere.  You don't need to do anything that makes you excessively anxious, and won't be forced to do anything.  The idea is to progress gradually.  Do not let your social anxiety keep you from coming to these meetings!  We are here to help.  If our locations are not convenient for you, please contact us so they we can keep a list of where there is greatest need. Please contact us with any questions or concerns.  Please check our new website at www.findyourvoicenj.org, or email at support@findyourvoicenl.org.

As stated above, this is a peer-run group.  We are not licensed therapists or mental health professionals.

There is a one-time fee of $15 for a 13-week series of meetings.  The first meeting is free and introductory, to get a "feel" for the group and format to see if it is right for you.  We use a workbook containing all the material and lots of supplemental information that is $15.  The 13-week series can be repeated as many times as needed until you reach all of your goals.  You will keep setting new goals with each series.  The locations are:

Moving Forward Self-Help Center: 25 Elizabeth Street, 2nd Floor, New Brunswick, NJ 08901. (Near Route 1 and Route 18). Serving Middlesex, Somerset, and Union counties, and parts of Mercer and Monmouth counties.

Senior Horizons Apartment Complex: 714 Clifton Ave, Clifton NJ 07110. Serving Passaic, Morris, Essex, Bergen, and Hudson counties.

Meetings at other locations will be announced.  Please let us know if you are interested in a particular location.

If you are joining while a series is in session, you are welcome to come as a guest and sit in for a meeting or 2, then start from the beginning of the series when it repeats.
results.name: Find Your Voice (Central and North Jersey Branch)

results.description: Skipping Club is BACK for Summer 2014!! Our old Meetup group got deleted but we hope you all find us again! Michelle Joni's Skipping Club is a fitness party in motion that brings back the joy of skipping. The Skipping Club Summer 2014 season is May 29 - Aug 7, a full summer of themed skipping adventures. Right now, it's training season at Little Skips in Bushwick, where you can skip and learn all about it April 10, 17, 24, and 26 at 2PM. For New Yorkers in the know, Skipping Club is a great source of fitness, a dose of joy in our week, a visceral way to get outside our comfort zones, an excuse to dress up, and a way to journey back to our youth. It's also a unique way to see the city and a faaaaaahbulous social outing. Every Thursday at 2 - and select happy hours, nights and weekends, Skipping Club skips a one-mile route, with intervals, exploring a new neighborhood around the city. From the Upper West Side and Central Park to Williamsburg, dive into a new theme - sartorially and spiritually. Enjoy curated music, improv-style games, meditations, urban adventures and a delicious hand-picked food and drink spot. Come skip, rediscover your playful innocence, paint the streets with joy, emit waves of positivity into the universe, and find your rhythm! I invite you to step into my imagination... and yours.

results.description:
Reiki Love New Jersey is a place for like-minded individuals throughout the area to come together and share their beautiful gifts. We hold our events in different places in central NJ, so don't pay too much attention to the listed group location!

We focus on a form of energy healing known as Reiki. What is it? It is better understood when broken apart. Rei is universal Wisdom and Ki is life force energy. When put together, Reiki means Universal Life Force Energy that is Divinely Guided. What Divine means is completely up to you: Reiki carries no dogma and requires no specific way of thinking, so it is compatible with any religion or set of beliefs. 

When people practice Reiki, they put aside their ego and thoughts to act as a simple channel for the energy, the same way a wire allows electricity to pass through. Anyone and everyone can benefit from Reiki, as the energy helps regulate blocked or deficient Ki. Your Ki is affected by your state of mind and your day-to-day life, and energetic disturbances eventually cause illness and dis-ease.  Reiki practitioners help restore your body, mind, and spirit to the natural state of pure perfection.

Reiki is a way to purify the holistic self, reduce stress and anxiety, and ultimately further one on his or her spiritual journey. Each person takes something different away from a session, because Reiki is always for your best and highest good. If you've never received it before, we encourage you to come to a share so that you can have a taste and see what it's all about.

Come join other beautiful souls as we share, explore and unfold the magic of Reiki!

https://www.facebook.com/njreikilove
results.name: Reiki Love New Jersey

results.description:
We call this a home game because it's played out of my living room (where I live with my girlfriend), and it basically started as a home game. Lately, we've been playing on our PRIVATE ROOFTOP - check out the pics! But this won't last as the weather gets colder. Then we'll take it back to our living room.

We're right here on 13th and 3rd, steps away from Union Square. 

We now open the game up to anyone interested, but screen tightly. We're looking for fellow normal people. We screen out thugs and riff-raff. Conversation at the table ranges from what so-and-so was saying during a TED talk, to whether Batman would beat Superman or vice versa (wow that sounds so much worse when you post it up for all to see), to some sports-betting talk, to... I dunno just normal stuff. 

The point is that it is not an intimidating group at all. Just seriously fun, relaxed vibe. If you killed the vibe, you seriously wouldn't be invited back! 

No one is out to "crush it" and try to pay rent with their poker winnings. There is one True Donkey here. It's seriously fun when he starts losing and goes on tilt. We all have a great time laughing at him while he whines about whatever hand being "so sick". He takes it like a champ, and it's all in good fun. 

How do you NOT wanna be a part of this good time?

FYI, in case it's not obvious: Please note that even though it may say that only 1 or 2 donkeys are attending the weekly meetup, the fact is that we are ALWAYS playing on Fridays. Almost all RSVPs happen via text, so you won't see the RSVP count increase on Meetup. 

Coming????
results.name: East Village - Donkey $1/2 Poker NLHE Cash Game

results.description:
Finally, a wellness group right here in Westchester! 

No more having to drive to Rockland or NYC. We now have an official place to call home: 

Andy's Pure Food is located on Purchase, St in the center of the town of Rye. Andy's was Est. in 2008 playing being an active roll in the innovation of "Healthy Living'  www.andyspurefood.com 

                      ....Until now, Andy's reputation has primarily been based on it's delicious raw, vegan, gluten free foods as well as its highly effective and affordable cleanses/detoxes. We are pleased to Announce the Launch of our Westchester's GO TO place to meet like minded individuals. Our focus is to raise awareness to all of the facets that evolve into fully balanced, healthy state. 

Join us in creating a 'KULA' : intentional community. 

No judgement, just positive vibes, lots of love and people who can relate. 

Come to learn, share, and connect. Enlighten yourself to the importance and understanding of foods relationship to our body. It is, in "Hippocrates" words "let food be your medicine." 

       Our mission is to make transitioning to a healthier life realistic, stimulating while still being fun and accessible. This Group is not exclusive to Vegan Foodies, it's an environment welcoming and accepting for people with any amount of curiosity. It's an opportunity to begin or to continue to cultivate an active lifestyle.

MeetUps will include: 

Amazing people, Unique perspectives, Delicious food, Laughing, Health Q+A, Films/documentaries. 

We will be hosting discussions, having speakers, and offering workshops. 

Topics Included: 

The nutritional 'make-up' of different foods, general anatomy, 

             the science behind yoga, breath  

.....and of course, food. 

Prevention, management and often reversing signs of aging, WEIGHT LOSS, Alternative health care, Holistic living/Transitional living, Individualized programs, group /support groups, Appreciating Life.

results.description:
New York Adventure Club 

Unlock Your City.


Who We Are

New York Adventure Club is a community driven club that curates unique tours and events for its 2,500+ person community, with a focus in history and storytelling.

Become a member of New York Adventure Club by joining our Meetup Page, Facebook Group, or newsletter from our website.


What We Do

New York Adventure Club is dedicated to helping locals discover off the beaten path architectural, historical, culinary, and cultural treasures around the city. After each event, there is an organized social hangout amongst members to forge new relationships and put a focus back on community.


Why We Do It

New York Adventure Club wants to make it fun and easy for locals to unlock the hidden secrets of their hometown, and realize that a true community can exist in such a large and overwhelming city.

results.description:
The NYC Strobist & Photoshop Collective is for people who own a Digital Camera with on or off camera Flash and want to learn to use them in a social setting. 

Photographers 

We look for those who have an interest in "Off Camera Flash" photography - commonly known as STROBIST photography. Members joining this group should be comfortable with basic concepts of how to manipulate their camera to take a photo and able to use their camera outside of the Auto mode. We also encourage those who wish to learn or improve their skills with post processing of digital images using Lightroom, Photoshop and various image enhancing plug-ins. If you often look to another photographer and are not afraid to ask for help or offer solutions you may find you are a good fit with this energetic and active group of snappers. 

Models

If you are a model or ever thought about giving it a try, you are also welcome to join the group and take advantage of serious photographers of all levels. Great place to network, allow practice for both ends of the camera, build portfolios and practice collaboration and skills that come with being a part of a shoot! 

Makeup Artists

We welcome you as well to join the group to practice your skills, try new concepts, network and build your portfolio!

More Info

Please see out About page: http://www.meetup.com/nycphotocollective/about/ to see if our group is a good fit for you.

Dues are $5.00 per year to help us cover costs for the meetup group. You can bring dues to your first meetup. No refunds are offered for this meetup group.
results.name: The NYC Strobist and Photoshop Collective

results.description:
This is a group for anyone in the NYC area that is passionate about Oracle Application Express (APEX) and is interested in meeting like minded folks to learn, share ideas, and have fun.

For those of you not in the know, APEX is a declarative framework for building web applications on the Oracle database. Using only a browser, and armed with just minimal knowledge of application development, it is possible to create robust, secure, and scalable web applications. APEX applications utilize the latest HTML5 and CSS3 technologies and even include a feature that can dynamic behavior to applications via JavaScript without having to write any code (Dynamic Actions). 

We are looking for sponsors! Do you have an APEX related event or job opening that you would like to let members of ORCLAPEX NYC know about? For $100 you will get up to 2 people into the event, a place to put your shwag, and a chance to introduce yourself to the audience. Please contact us if you are interested in being a sponsor.
results.name: ORCLAPEX NYC

results.description:
This is a friendly group for anyone looking to find or land a new job OR get the word out about a job opening in your network. Whether unemployed, unhappily employed, interviewing, a recent grad, or a recruiter, this is for all career levels and situations. I am a career strategy and job search coach with a background in executive recruiting and hiring. I started this group because I want to help people navigate the job hunt in a savvy, successful way, while also connecting with others in similar situations.  

My networking philosophy is all about meeting a variety of people, asking for a job and helping others by giving away job help in return.  You never know who is in someone else's network so by sharing your needs and giving job leads to others, you will start to build new relationships and potentially generate your own job leads in return!

results.description:
Calling all long island meditators! Come join us for a group meditation on long island that will change your life. All religions and denominations are welcome. Come experience for yourself, the incredible social and personal benefits of group meditation. There have been numerous studies that have shown that a group of people meditating has significant measurable effects. The beauty of a group meditation is that you can experience both self-exploration while also connecting to the energy of others. Long Island Meditation is a great place for beginners and experienced meditators alike. Come on down, make some new friends and surround yourself with a great group of spiritual, like minded people interested in finding inner peace and happiness.



We are currently meeting at Fuel the Soul, 188 Merrick Road in Merrick NY. The talks begin at 7:30 and the guided meditation begins promptly at 8.


Some helpful Q&A:

What should I wear?

-Please wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat.


Who will be there?

-This meet-up consists of other like-minded Long Islanders interested in experiencing the benefits of Meditation. This is a beginners class so it's very laid back and comfortable. Please feel free to come by yourself or bring a friend.


What can I expect?

-The Long Island Meditation Group meets at Fuel the Soul at 7:30. We typically have a guest speaker that offers a brief talk about one of the following subjects; Reiki, Yoga, Meditation, Empowerment, Spirituality, New Thought & Healing. The group guided meditation begins promptly at 8. 


What are people saying?

-Here is a testimonial: I've been attending Mark Chabus' guided meditation workshop for the past 5-6 weeks. By nature, for the past few years anyway, I've turned into a real worrier and pessimist, due to a few downturns in my life, so I thought I could use this class. Well, there was another bump in the road in my family life (my daughter lost her job) but instead of my typical hand-wringing, poor us, reaction, I felt a sense of anticipation and excitement for her...automatically, without trying. I feel I've been re-wired by Mark's weekly guidance and my subsequent daily practice. Would I say it's a miracle?  I think so...... The point is, it works.  Come join us and see for yourself.  Thank you, Mark. I'm SO glad our paths have crossed.  -C.O.


Where do I park?

You can park in the AT&T Parking lot. You can also park on Merrick Road or on the side street in between Pastrami King and Dunkin Donuts.
results.name: Long Island Meditation Meetup

results.description:
Primordial Voice (PV) practice is a shortcut to your primordial self, to your own unique power, to your true, authentic being. Primordial voice is given to every single human. It is and intelligence on its own, the most amazing inbuilt guidance system, it is a healer within. PV is active in children up to the age of 3 years and can be activated during sexual experience, a serious illness or a form of mourning which is actually a healing vibration.
Through Primordial Voice Technique you can reach untapped phenomenal abilities everyone possesses. These abilities are often hidden deep inside and accessed through the power of one’s own Primordial Voice, a very powerful teaching allowing to re-recognize one’s own strength.

Primordial Voice teaches you to reach forgotten self confidence and live in agreement with your own true self. A grown-up person has 2 voices: a “thinking” voice which is active, and primordial one which is usually dormant. A “thinking” voice is a voice connected to the intellect that communicates the data registered by the brain. The vocal cords and muscles are used to produce a thinking brain. Primordial Voice is connected to the “gut” or “heart” , it is produced by trachea and smooth muscles that are connected to our subconscious mind. It communicates our inner wisdom, our inner guidance; it says, “I lead you, I guide you”.
Knowing your Primordial Voice and recognizing it is the most powerful tool to the secret of life, making the right choices, committing to the right situations, and interacting with the right people. Remember, you have spent many years trying to change yourself just to fit the general standards, to acquire qualities that are not yours and do not reflect your unique nature. The question is whether or not you have succeeded? And does your success set you free?

Primordial Voice is not about changing or improving: it is about KNOWING yourself and living in accordance with your TRUE SELF. Knowing who you are is the key to your freedom. The PV program is a course consisting of several stages of special exercises, breath work and energy work, and although it takes time to master this technique, even one hour of this work will give you the experience of what it is like to be your own master. Suppression of your Primordial Voice creates patterns of disharmony and disruption of your body/mind connection and well-being.

By opening to Primordial Voice and freeing its movement in your body, you will experience:

Connection with the source
Freedom of the creative force within
Feelings of bliss and happiness
A strengthening of your intuition
A shifting of blocks in your life force (Qi)
??????????????????????
Personal power
A deepening and improvement in your voice
An expansion of personal skills and professional effectiveness
You will be heard!
And you will learn how to heal yourself with Primordial Voice on a deep physical and emotional level.

results.description:
Albertson Memorial Church
293 Sound Beach Avenue
Old Greenwich, CT 06870

ABOUT OUR CHURCH:
Albertson Memorial Church of Spiritualism is a member of the National Spiritualist Association of Churches and the Connecticut State Spiritualist Association.

OUR PURPOSE:
 We are passionate about spreading the message of Spiritualism: The knowledge that after our life in the body ends, our spirit lives on. It is reassuring beyond words to know this truth - which we demonstrate through Mediumship (communications with spirit). Our mission is to share the light, love and knowledge of spirit without divisive dogma or restrictive rules. We create an open and loving atmosphere within the Church; one which welcomes people from all faiths and denominations.

WHAT IS A MEDIUM AND/OR MEDIUMSHIP?
A medium is a person who is sensitive to the thought and energy vibrations which come to us from those in Spirit. A medium can attune to the Spirit people, and is able to describe them and relate their thoughts, emotions, memories, and messages. Mediumship is a natural gift of the Spirit and has many purposes: it brings comfort to the bereaved; it offers spiritual nourishment for the soul; it becomes a vehicle for God’s Healing Spirit; and it demonstrates the potential of the individual to break through self-imposed limitation and, thus, become part of a Greater Whole.

WHAT IS SPIRITUAL HEALING?
An important part of of the Spiritualist experience is healing. Healers are simply channels for healing; the source of all healing is God. Our trained and designated healers direct healing light and energy according to each individual's needs. At every Sunday service during a period of meditation, we offer the opportunity to sit in one of our healing chairs for hands-on energy healing (given by a touch on your shoulders).

IS SPIRITUALISM A CHRISTIAN DENOMINATION?
Spiritualism is the vehicle through which all religions have been given birth. We embrace the teachings and example of Jesus of Nazareth. We consider Jesus a great prophet, medium and healer. His connection with the Divine was so strong that one could consider him as God's Presence on Earth. Was he the only such manifestation of God's Love and Grace? No. During times of spiritual crisis, God sends messengers of the Word to help guide us; Jesus, Abraham, Moses, Buddha, Krishna and Mohammed, to name a few. One can be Christian and a Spiritualist; one can be Jewish and a Spiritualist; one can be Buddhist and a Spiritualist; etc.


SUNDAY SERVICE:
The highlight of our Church week is Sunday worship. Our worship service integrates music, prayer, healing, meditation, inspiration and Spirit communication into the beautiful and unique experience of Spiritualist worship. Each week our church invites a guest minister. Sunday service begins at 11:00 AM and ends at approximately 12:15 PM. You are cordially invited to join us in the Church Hall for coffee, refreshments and fellowship following the service. (Doors Open at 10:30 AM for Silent Prayer and Meditation).

The Typical Order of Service:

• Opening Song and Prayer

• Declaration of Principles

• Sermon / Sharing

• Healing Prayer and Meditation

• Laying-on-of-Hands Healing

• Offering

• Announcements

• Hymn

• Spirit Greetings (Mediumship)

• Closing Song: "Let There Be Peace on Earth"



WORKSHOPS:
Our guest ministers and other spiritual practitioners provide workshops on various subjects relating to Spirituality, Mediumship Development, Psychic Development, Healing and much more. All are welcome to join - newcomers are encouraged! There is a suggested donation listed for each event (however, we do not turn anyone away for inability to pay the full amount). Many of our classes are held on weekdays in the evening, and on Sunday after worship. Please check our calendar of events and/or web site (which is updated more frequently) for additional information regarding exact dates and times.

PSYCHIC / SPIRITUAL FAIR:
Albertson Memorial Church holds a Spiritual Fair on the first Saturday of every month from 12pm-5pm. (Please note: our July Fair will be on the second Saturday , July 12, NOT on the July 4th weekend!) Psychic readings are 25 minutes each and range from $40 to $50. The energy healing sessions are 20 minutes for $20. Healing is also available for pets (leash or carrier only). Admission is FREE -- cash and personal checks are accepted -- reservations are not needed, but you may email albertsonchurch@gmail.com if you want to reserve a spot!

• Church web site: www.AlbertsonChurch.org

• Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/AlbertsonMemorialChurchOfSpiritualism
results.name: Albertson Memorial Church of Spiritualism

Urban Creative Retreats

                                No art experience required, and all levels are welcome!

The purpose of this group is:

To encourage and inspire others to explore their creative side by fostering a creative space that is supportive and non judgmental.  Most importantly it's to HAVE FUN! 

This group is great for everyone, especially if you are willing to:

• Meet new and like-minded people in a no pressure group to explore your own creativity.

• Leave your preconceived notions of what you can and cannot do at the door;

• Put aside any doubt of your abilities.

• Be open to learning and sharing new techniques.

• Have Fun!

Who this meet up will benefit:

• People under stress, or if those just need to get away for a few hours.

• Are you a person who avoids at all costs sitting down to write, paint, or work?

• Do you finally sit down and go blank or get distracted?

• Do you have tons of creative ideas only to not follow through?

• Those who enjoy the process of continual self-discovery?

• Those who enjoy having fun!

This will give you a special place to come to that is welcoming, healing and creative.

It's a place where you can be yourself, express yourself and find yourself at the same time. Time for creative play!

Stay tuned for artists dates and collaborative work days

We might meet at a coffee house or the beach to just make our art, write, edit or anything that makes you feel inspired or creative in a supportive, friendly and fun atmosphere.

We'll be each others' cheerleaders on our journey.

If this sounds good, come join us.

……..oh, and it’s ok if you spill the glue!

results.description:
Product Secrets is a monthly meetup where we invite an expert on a specific topic to teach us their secrets and help people in product development do their jobs better. We think that the best way to solve the challenges that come up in product development are to get everyone involved in a room together - if engineers, designers, and product managers can all have an open conversation together, we think they're much more likely to come up with good ideas.

We were tired of all the meetups we went to being uninspiring and full of recruiters, so we built the meetup we've always wanted. Each month, we host an expert in a specific topic to answer the question "What's your secret?" The goal is to help everyone who attends learn something that can help them take a new skill or idea with them to work the next day. We also have a strong focus on networking, because making connections with other interesting people is where we think most of the value in these meetups lies.

Important: this meetup is for product managers, engineers, designers, and other people actively working on a digital product (support specialists, QA engineers, company founders, etc). To that end:

• Fill out your member profile accurately and completely. As each event fills up and the waitlist grows, we will give priority to people who make it clear what they're doing, what they can contribute, and what they want to learn.

• Recruiters are strictly prohibited from attending. Business development and marketing professionals are welcome to attend if they are interested in product development, but people with a more direct involvement will get priority in the case of an oversold event.
results.name: Product Secrets

results.description:
Sometime in the late sixteen hundreds, this very bright British chap named John Locke defined goodness as that which creates happiness. Sounds good so far. Almost two thousand years earlier another also very sharp Greek dude named Aristotle wrote that not only is happiness the greatest good, it’s the only end in life, everything else being just a means. Okay, that makes sense too.

This group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them whenever and however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions:

1. Keep busy and be more active

2. Spend more time socializing

3. Be productive at meaningful work

4. Get better organized and plan things out

5. Stop worrying

6. Lower your expectations and aspirations

7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking

8. Become present oriented

9. Develop an outgoing, social personality

10. Work on a healthy personality

11. Be yourself

12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems

13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness

14. Put happiness as your most important priority.


Here's some background on the research our group is based on:

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!


Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change

By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions

By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: The Happiness and Goodness Club - White Plains

Hello and Welcome aboard! I formed this walk group for people who are new to the area (or old) or even considering moving into an area and would like to explore the different cool parts of the towns and cities along the Hudson. I always feel that people move into a specific area only after having probably zipped through the neighborhood sitting in a car. Well yes, one does get a "vague" idea of the place but do you really get to enjoy it? Then do you come back again and again to take in the flavour? Maybe, maybe not. So as a way to give back to the society I decided to form this meetup. Usually the walks will not be over bearing or long. However for your & everyone else's enjoyment, you have to be physically fit to be walking and being on foot for at least an hour or more. To keep it interesting we can end the walk in an interesting place to eat or drink from time to time. Every meetup we'll be exploring different areas for Jersey City, Hoboken and West NewYork. If you want more cities to be added feel free to get in touch with me.

*Members should understand and agree that they will be obligated to pay the bill for the food or drinks they have incase the meetup ends at a place of food or drinks.

*As a member of this group you are not allowed to solicit other members for your products, business or services. NO EXCEPTIONS! This is a meetup for fun lets keep it that way.

* If you RSVP to a meet you are expected to show up.

*No shows will be strictly not tolerated! You have to inform at least 24 hours in advance.

* You have to wear comfortable and appropriate clothing and foot wear.

Liability Waiver:
Walking and similar outdoor activities have inherent risks associated with it. Your participation in my walks, carpools or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency or even death. You agree to participate completely at your own risk and understand that you are taking full responsibility for your own safety and well being at all times.

results.description:
Life is always full of challenges, often causing stressful situations. We can not eliminate challenges, however can learn to manage them in a manner that can avoid 'burn-out' and increase our ability to handle stressful situations. Quiet often, these stressful situations are too common in our daily lives and can be seen as 'normal' living and one gets accustomed to unhealthy living or life conditions. There are various ways to deal with stressful issues and situations. Relaxation and deep-breathing is one of those techniques that has been scientifically proven to show positive result and health benefits. The deep breathing and relaxation, or meditation are well known in the ancient 'Wisdom Traditions' and have been practiced for thousands of years. Often, the objectives were to seek spiritual awareness, introspection, self-exploration, single-mindedness, cultivation of mindfulness, and connecting with 'Higher-Self'. I modern day living, regardless of how we approach, we can deny the benefits achieved from the practice of deep-breathing for relaxation, connecting with our inner-self, promoting our own well being from the regular practice of Relaxation Techniques.

We have programs for beginners, practitioners, and small or large groups.

Schedules and Costs:

Suggested Donation $12.00 (or a 10 session card for $100.00 no expiry, use as long as you want) 

-  Thursdays: 6:30 PM – 7:30 PM – Sound/Vibration techniques for healing

-  Fridays: 6:30 PM – 7:30 PM – Focus on various topics and techniques  each week (per audience need)

results.description:
Apache Mesos is a cluster manager that provides efficient resource isolation and sharing across distributed applications, or frameworks. It can run Hadoop, Jenkins, Spark, Aurora, and other applications on a dynamically shared pool of nodes.

Features:

• Fault-tolerant replicated master using ZooKeeper

• Scalability to 10,000s of nodes

• Isolation between tasks with Linux Containers

• Multi-resource scheduling (memory and CPU aware)

• Java, Python and C++ APIs for developing new parallel applications

• Web UI for viewing cluster state

One way to think about the difference between Mesos and "cloud" solutions is around how they manage their resources.  There is a lot of latency when using Hypervisors (which is what cloud environment use). Mesos operates with cgroups at the kernel level giving you the same isolation but faster from a network, and system perspective.  

Mesos also abstracts out the scheduling of resources from the management of resources giving you the ability to create any type of scheduler that makes sense for you (or use existing ones) and still get the same kernel benefits.  Think of your scheduler as init.d for your data center servers as a whole and Mesos as the kernel of your entire data center and every computing server in it.
results.name: Apache Mesos NYC Meetup

results.description: We meet every Sunday from 7:00-8:15 pm at the Wellspring Health Collective in Maplewood. Whether you are a longtime meditator or new to the practice, you are welcome to join us. Instruction will be given. Together, we can practice staying grounded in the present moment by stopping, focusing on our breathing, and observing our thoughts and feelings without getting lost in them. By sitting and walking in this way, we can gain clarity, spaciousness and the ability to stay present to whatever arises without reacting habitually. By continually practicing with the support of community, our commitment to living mindfully is strengthened and our concentration deepens. There will be guided and silent sittings and a period of walking meditation, along with a reading and time to share and practice mindful speech and listening. The practice is influenced by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh, Pema Chodron, and the teachers of the Insight Meditation tradition. There is a suggested donation of $10. No advanced registration required.
results.name: Maplewood/South Orange Mindfulness Meditation Group

results.description:
Are you looking to meet girl friends in the Millburn/Cranford NJ area (Short Hills, Springfield, Summit, Madison, Chatham, Maplewood, Westfield, South Orange, or surrounding area)? Are you in your late 20's to late 30's? Are you new to the area or interested in meeting some friends in the area for meals, drinks, happy hour, brunch, outings, day activities, sporting events, picnics, crafts, etc. etc.? If so, than this might be the group for you!!

As one member said, she is looking for a group in the area that is beyond a singles group but before a baby group -  and that is exactly where members of this group tend to fall!

There is no bias against those a bit further from Millburn/Cranford nor those single or with kids. This group was created to find like-minded friends to get to know and hopefully build meaningful friendships. Most events will be limited in attendance (5-15 ladies) in order to better get to know each other.

Events for this group include:  paint & wine class, mud run, hike (fall), picnic in the park, meet for coffee, wine tasting, concerts/shows, and of course dinners, drinks/happy hour, and brunches!  Suggestions for meetups are always welcome and our members sometimes take on the role of 'event host' to pick/plan an event at the venue/date of their choice!  :)  

NOTE:  The goal is to keep this group on the small side (under 125 people) and therefore members who are not active (those who don't attend events and/or message and keep in touch with the group) will be removed.  New members will be added occasionally to keep things fresh.  Eventually, we'll have a core group that is actively engaged, which is the key here.  I appreciate your understanding!  

FEE - why is there a $5/year fee?   Because MeetUp groups cost money (the organizer pays) and prices just went up a lot this year.  $5/year covers the cost of the group and  perhaps helps find members who are more serious about joining a great group!

Governance - in order to best maintain this group and to be considerate of others, there is a "2 limit no-show policy"  - because these events are smaller, if you are a no-show at 2 events, you will be removed from the group.  Reminders are sent the week of the event and the day before/day of - so if you signed up for an event and can no longer attend, just let me know (or change your RSVP) and we'll have another member take your spot.  This is especially important on events requiring reservations or those with a wait-list.   Understanding that life gets busy - non-active members will be removed after 4 months, unless they've reached out to the organizer for reasoning.  Thank you!
results.name: Girl Friends near Millburn/Cranford NJ (late 20's - 30's)

The group is inspired by studying with world famous improvisors Bobby McFerrin, Rhiannon, Joey Blake, David Worm, Bob Stoloff, Kate Richards Geller and Ysaye Barnwell. We will do many games based on Rhiannon's book Vocal River and other wonderful teachers exercises, such as Bobby McFerrin's CircleSong.

We will create improvised songs with multiple vocal parts, interesting rhythms and opportunities to share the joy of being alive and together in this time and place.  <3

results.description:
We're a group dedicated to helping new software developers get started. We welcome mentors, educators, software developers of all skill levels, and companies interested in hiring new developers for internships, apprenticeships, first-hires, or junior roles.

As mentors, instructors and educators, how do we develop curricula that gets developers ready for software development? How do we test and iterate?

As software developers and architects, how do we write codebases that are straightforward and clean? How do we best optimize for productivity from newer developers?

As newer software developers, how do we filter out the noise? How do we find career coaching and mentorship? How do we move from a structured learning environment to a self-taught one?

There are a lot of people in the software community in NYC who want to help new developers succeed. That's our goal.

We'll be hosting roundtable discussions, planning sessions, and other, more tech-focused events.
results.name: init developer

I am a Certified Circle of Life Health and Wellness Coach.  I have been on the healing path for almost 30 years and I have had extensive training in different health and wellness modalities, counseling, expressive arts therapy, and teaching. I have helped individuals and groups create the lives they want to live.

I believe in the The Circle of Life approach to changing lives because it deals with all of the aspects of your life. You get to go within yourself and see what it is you would like to change or see differently and then take action steps to get there.  It is very empowering to make changes to your life, instead of being a victim to life's circumstances.  The self-care, mind/body exercises that you will practice in the sessions are a wonderful way to relieve stress and feel renewed.  You will also do visioning exercises to create the life you want.

I am so grateful to be able to share this healing work and I look forward to meeting you.   

Please see my website @ www.thesparkwithin.net for further information.

You're in this group because you love people & community! Our meet-ups involve home-cookin' and sharing experiences. Our typical meet-ups are in homes, around the dinner table (or sitting on the floor!), enjoying homemade food. 


Like to eat? This is the place for you. Meal Sharing makes it possible to find awesome home-cooked meals in locals' homes. We are the New York Meet Up for Mealsharing, the international platform that connects people to home-cooked meals all over the world. It's in over 450 cities...so let's MealShare here in NYC! 

Join up for some good homestyle cooking, new friends, and community involvement. This is the New York Meal Sharing group, where Meal Sharers can keep in touch with their community and with travelers coming through! We get and make home-cooked meals from both across the world and from across the street. We love food and people! You don't need to be backpacking to get a homecooked meal anywhere.  We want to bring our stories, our recipes, and our cultures to the table and share them. Everyone who eats or cooks is welcome to be a part of Meal Sharing! How to be involved?

Check us out on our website and keep us with us on twitter and facebook! If you'd like to host a mealshare, here the link!

results.description: The goal of UX Debate Club is to provide an appropriate forum to challenge and test popular wisdom, fight dogma, and develop new ideas. At conferences, events, and even Meetups, it is usually not appropriate to challenge a presenter's thesis without looking like...well...a jerk, but as UXers we want to see people's thought process and how they arrived at their conclusions. A debate is a great way to do just that, and we get to collectively look at problems, questions, or theories from both sides. The UX Debate Club uses an Oxford-Style debate format to encourage everyone to participate while exchanging ideas, banishing dogma and having fun.
results.name: UX Debate Club

The Cannabis and Hemp Association is an organization established in May 2014 to rapidly educate and provide networking opportunities to people interested in the miracle plant, cannabis. 

The CHA is focused on (3) initiatives:

1) Building Community-We give people with an interest in cannabis an opportunity to enjoy FUN and SAFE events in and around the New York Metropolitan Area.

2) Raising Awareness-Create media and exchange ideas to explore the latest news and discuss the history, people, places, and things involving cannabis.

3) Taking Action-Developing programs (such as this Meetup group) to further the acceptance of cannabis at the local, national, and global level.


We hope you will join as an Affiliate and consider becoming a Member. When you are a Member of the CHA you will officially align yourself with an organization doing positive initiatives, outreach, and a multitude of projects. As cannabis becomes more understood and further celebrated, having an association to a group can potentially be something of value when networking with others within the industry. 


------------------------------------------------------------------



Meetup.com "CHA Affiliates" are not CHA Members and should not represent themselves as such. CHA Membership is available online at cannabisandhemp.org only.<br>

Please go to our website for more information or contact us: cannabisandhemp@gmail.com CANNABISANDHEMP.ORG

We blog on all matters cannabis and hemp on the website. If you have any news to report or discuss please checkout the blog on cannabisandhemp.org


LIKE US ON FACEBOOK.COM/CHAWORLDWIDE

TWITTER @CANNABISANDHEMP
results.name: Cannabis and Hemp Association-New York

results.description:
This group has 'street hockey' in its name because we play traditional street hockey! Traditional street hockey comprises sticks and sneakers. Not roller-blades. While we do sometimes play roller hockey, you should assume that a given session is the traditional sort. You're welcome to bring your roller blades and muck about in them before or after our sessions. Occasionally, we also mix things up such that each team, for example, will have have 4 people in sneakers and two in blades. And it always works. 

Our games tend to run at an intermediate level. While some players are quite advanced, others are sometimes completely new to the game. 

If you're totally new to the game, you should feel welcome. If you'd like some tips or even lessons, I'm happy to offer them - and for free.  I love coaching, and my experience at it is fairly decent: I've coached people of all abilities - including players who went on to make pro leagues. Most recently, I provided one-to-one training for a 2014 US women's deck hockey player. Feel free to take me up on the offer because I really do enjoy it!

There is a small fee for each session. Just $5. All proceeds go to a non-profit sports program I created (and run) for NYC's underfunded public schools: see nyisl.com for more information.

EQUIPMENT: 

On almost every occasion, we will have proper hockey nets as well as two goalies. When two goalies aren't available, we will set up 'pond hockey goals' - i.e., small goals or targets.

It would be great if you could bring your own stick. But if you don't have a stick, write the organizers and they'll be able to bring you one.  Make sure to specify if you shoot Left or Right!

While we don't require that you wear any protective gear (and while most people don't even wear gloves), you should seriously consider the merits of gloves, shin guards, mouth guards, and helmets with cages.

RULES: 

Standard rules of hockey apply, with some minor exceptions (see below). 

To help ensure safety - especially for those who choose not to wear helmets, face masks, mouth guards, or shin guards - we have a few very strict 'stick-related' rules:

1. No stick lifting.

2. No hacking (i.e., no smacking your stick on top of someone else's stick).

3. No sticks above waist height at any time.

4. No slap shots.

5. No using the stick against someone's back, front, side, between the legs, or anywhere else on the body - even if it's a light touch. 

A quick demonstration of what is and what isn't allowed will be performed by an organizer before every session.

MOST IMPORTANTLY, in order to help foster an easy-going, welcoming and safe environment, this group also has a strict non-violence & non-aggression policy :

**** If a player uses his/her stick in any violent way; if he/she throws a punch, elbow, or kick; if she/he threatens another player or challenges another player to a fight; if she/he uses abusive or offensive language towards another player, then the player in question will be immediately removed from this meetup group and permanently banned from future participation. ****

By signing up to this meetup group and to any of its events, you agree to the following LEGAL DISCLAIMER.
results.name: NYC Street Hockey

Stage 4:
Attaining Atma Sakshatkar (Self Realization), Experience of Cosmic Executor and Experience of Eternal Sadguru

Realization of Supreme Being and attaining Union

results.description:
This Meetup was created in the hopes of having one central listing for all NYC history related events in the city.   In a way this is more of calendar than it is a Meetup, but if people enjoy this resource then I would be down to create more social types of event.  And if you do plan to go to an event feel free to RSVP and invite people for pre- or post- event hanging out.

  Also if you enjoy this resource and want to help out please feel free to contact me.  I want to add events from as many sources as possible, but it might be a bit much for one man.

  Also a few disclaimers.  

  One, I do own a sightseeing company for full disclosure, but I will mention which if any events are from my company.  I don't think I'll list many at all or for a while.

  Two, I will provide links to all the venues with the event posting.  If you want to confirm that you will be able to join an event check there to see if it's been canceled or is sold out.

  Three, event hosts in this Meetup means that they manage the posting, not that they will actually be attending the event (unless they say otherwise.)  If you are attending the event and want to let people know RSVP.  If you would like to do something before or after the event let people know in the comments.  With that having been said here's the criteria for the events I list.

  1)  Must be New York City related in some way.  Related being the key word.  If there's a talk on the Dutch colonial period, but not specifically on New York I might throw it in the mix. 

  2)  Must be history related in some significant way.  Doesn't have to be all history based to qualify.  A tour of the High Line that talks about the future plans of the site in addition to it's history is fine.  An event that only talks about present or future events will not be added.

     For the purposes of this Meetup I will say it will have to deal with events at least 20 years old to be "historical".

  3)  Daily or weekly events will not (for the time being) be added to this Meetup to prevent clutter.

  Enjoy and please feel free to give me feedback.

  SOME PLACES WE CHECK FOR EVENTS:

  BROOKLYN BRAINERY / BROOKLYN HISTORICAL SOCIETY / BROOKLYN PUBLIC LIBRARY / MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK / NEW YORK CITY DEPARTMENT OF PARKS & RECREATION / NEW YORK HISTORICAL SOCIETY / NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY / THE MUNICIPAL ARTS SOCIETY 

  We also check other random sites out.
results.name: NYC History Event Listings

The Creative Business has a lot of room for improvement.

Independent Creative Professionals and Businesses both benefit by getting together to understand common interests - namely expanding business horizons.

If you are a running a business do you wish you were more confident in your marketing investments? Do you find you waste a lot of time managing disparate contractors and wish they were collaborating to find synergies that will make your investment go further?

If you are an independent creative professional, do you think you are "leaving money on the table" because your clients need expertise beyond yours to integrate a comprehensive marketing presence?

COMRADITY Strategy & Creative Resource Center is a new concept. 

Our mission is to be a neutral space where creative professionals and business can collaborate on a project basis. We offer resources to think - private offices or desks, to meet - private rooms for 4 to 60, and to make -  HD Web Video production, live or recorded, and a 3-d printer.

The invitation only Member Network is a private professional social network where members connect. The benefits to connecting are:

1) Expand Horizons: Sure, most creative folks need time and space to work alone. But as the demand for interactive multimedia content grows, we need to partner with others who can expand our capabilities. 

2) Learn: Traditional and digital strategist and content producers have a lot to learn from each other.  Traditional professionals know the secrets to great content. Digital professionals understand the technicalities of designing content for the context - where, when, and how that content will be consumed.

3) Build chemistry: Developing and executing interactive multimedia takes a team, and we all know that a team with chemistry will outperform a rockstar alone.

Businesses benefit from an ecosystem of connected creative professionals whom they can hire on a project basis. 

1) They don't need to invest the time to manage diverse actors who aren't accustomed to working together.

2) They benefit from the synergies of integration.

3) They benefit from exceeding their expectations when a teams bring ideas to them.

Monday Morning Open Houses from 8-10AM are a time for a tour and to meet members.
results.name: Strategy & Creative Project Marketplace

results.description:
Interested in Spiritual Enlightenment and Meditation?

Want to meet new people and make new friends?

Want to learn about or enhance your spiritual awareness?

Want to experience something new and different?

 Well wonder no further!

There is a traditional Asian ceremony where you get to view how spiritual ceremonies were performed thousands of years ago. These ceremonies were performed for spiritual blessings similar to how Native Americans held ceremonies for spiritual blessings and protection. You even get a chance to participate in one. It has been part of the Japanese culture for many years. It is truly an amazing cultural and spiritual experience to witness.

There's also the option of a spiritual meditation session afterwards. This unique type of meditation is known as Shugen and it has been practiced for thousands of years all over the world. The meditation provides spiritual enlightenment, inner peace, willpower, and development of self-discipline and well-being. We also offer weekly meditation sessions, seminars, discussions, and workshops on this wonderful Asian spirituality and culture.

Please join us for this wonderful event!

We are located now in Brooklyn, NY

results.description:
Welcome to the World Taiji Boxing Association - Erle Montaigue's Fa-jing Ch'uan School of Fighting and Healing in New York City. This is a group where you can keep updated on classes, workshops and special events offered by the school. 

The Old Yang Style is the style of T'ai Chi Ch'uan developed originally by its founder, Yang Lu-ch’an, in the 19th century; a style that has its roots in Wudang Chuan and Dim-Mak, which confers on it its Medical/Martial nature; consequentially leading to a better communion with the Universe, as it was originally intended.

Even though this is the original system, nowadays what is widely known as Yang Style T'ai Chi Ch'uan is the style developed by one of Lu-Ch'an's grandsons, Yang Chengfu; a man who did an extraordinary job by simplifying the form and training methods to make them more accessible for everybody, disregarding their current health condition or age. Yet, its medical/martial origin was gradually stripped from it by subsequent generations of practitioners, rendering a form that is definitely better than not doing any type of physical activity, yet not able to deliver all its unmeasurable potential. 

Therefore, a difference must be made between this worldwide known style, and the original style that was passed down by Lu-Ch'an's other grandson, Yang Shou-hou, and preserved by the World Taiji Boxing Association, that will enable the serious practitioner to take advantage of all the benefits offered by the work of geniuses. The training takes the practitioner through self-healing, martial and, eventually, medical levels of apprenticeship and practice. 

A more detailed primary training is as follows: 

-Self Healing and Martial Qi Gong 

-Yang Lu-ch'an's Form

 -Tui Shou (Push Hands) 

-Small San Sau (Self Defense form) 

Feel free to come and train in any of our classes, where you will find an environment where friendship, cordiality, respect and lots of hard work is the rule.
results.name: World Taiji Boxing Association - New York City

Moyu, meaning breast milk in Korean, is ShinYeon Moon’s attempt to re-nourish her memories of an uprooted past. By letting go of the past and the uncertainty of the future, she is attempting to find solace in the present. Through her artwork, she contemplates how to maintain a meditative balance in life, illustrating her attempts at finding stability in the blur between the real and the imagined, amidst the lonely silence and strangely comforting space that remains in the in-between.

[null], Cantor Media Center, New York, NY, May 2013

results.description:
Welcome to NYC iOS Swift Developers!  We are thrilled with the response to this Meetup, and excited to help introduce and develop Apple’s new programming language, Swift, with our community.  We welcome anyone interested in iOS development to join our Meetup, but before signing up for an event, please note our format below.  

What this is:

A group of developers of varying backgrounds, coming together to discuss and begin the transition to Apple’s new programming language, Swift.  From week to week, we will cover a variety of functionalities across Swift, Cocoa, Objective-C, and Xcode 6 with a focus in iOS 8 for Apple’s multi-touch devices.  While we have general topics that our organizers will cover during each Meetup, we will not be locked into an agenda.  Instead, we will use the time to share / develop ideas and information in an informal, discussion format.

What this is not:

This is not a Meetup for those who are brand new to / have no experience in development.  We are not teaching a course on Swift, presenting slides, or giving assignments.  If you are interested in learning iOS development and / or Swift, please get in touch with our co-organizer, Matt Knedler at mknedler@adev.us, who will be able to give you more information about the various courses we offer in NYC and Stamford, CT.  Our next 3-Day Swift Intensive begins Friday, August 14th, 2014.

Subject experts are welcome to present topics relevant to iOS development at future Meetups. If you are interested in presenting at a future meetup, please tell us which topic(s) you’d like to present when filling out your profile, or by emailing mknedler@adev.us.

About our Organizers:

Aferdita Muriqi, CEO, ADEV, Inc.

Aferdita Muriqi has over 18 years of experience in development, design and analysis of mobile and web enterprise applications.  In 2010 she founded ADEV, Inc., a global mobile application development company comprised of a talented team of mobile designers, engineers and marketing specialists.  Aferdita currently conducts iOS development bootcamps for corporations and individuals throughout Stamford and NYC, and serves as an adjunct professor at NYU-SCPS, teaching multiple iOS and Android app development certificate courses.

Aferdita has extensive experience building custom mobile and web applications across a vast array of topics including e-commerce, music and entertainment, social networking and business applications.  ADEV services range from initial concept, design, development, testing, product delivery and video production focused on innovative applications and promotional solutions.  For more information, please visit the ADEV website at http://adev.us.

Isaac Rivera, Sr. Front-End Developer, Interactive One 

Isaac has been a front-end web developer in NYC since 1999. He has worked for HBO, AOL, and presently, Interactive One, where he is a Sr. Front-End Developer for the Innovation Team. He has also collaborated with small development studios where he has participated on projects for the National Building Museum, NPR and Scholastic. In the past, Isaac had specialized in ActionScript 3, Javascrtipt and XML. Today Isaac primarily works in HTML5, CSS, Javascript, and JSON with some PHP and SQL. Isaac has completed certificate programs at NYU in Java OOP and, most recently, iOS Development.

Founded by Radio One in 2007, Interactive One is the number one digital platform for the Black, Latino & new urban communities, reaching over 20 million unique visitors a month with over 60 websites in 16 different local markets.  Flagship properties include HelloBeautiful.com, TheUrbanDaily.com & BlackPlanet. Learn more at www.interactiveone.com

Thanks for visiting, and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: NYC iOS Swift Developers

results.description: I will begin with a quote from Rob Collie (Excel Guru): "YOU are the army that the world needs. You just needed an upgrade to your toolset. PowerPivot provides that upgrade and then some. I would say that we probably needed a 50% upgrade to Excel, but what we got is more like a 500% upgrade; and that is not a number I throw around lightly. Imagine the year is 1910, and you are one of the world's first biplane pilots. One day at the airfield, someone magically appears and gives you a brand-new 2012 jet plane. You climb inside and discover that the cockpit has been designed to mimic the cockpit of your 1910 biplane! You receive a DRAMATIC upgrade to your aircraft without having to learn how to fly from scratch. That is the kind of 'gift' that PowerPivot provides to Excel Pros." The purpose of this Meetup is to explore this new "toolset" and push our Excel data-crunching prowess to the maximum. I would like to begin with the founding members, going chapter by chapter, as a group, through Rob Collie's book, "DAX Formulas for PowerPivot, A Simple Guide to the Excel Revolution". I imagine, that if the group grows, those founding members will then be well-versed enough to provide instruction and guidance to new groups members. This is a very exciting new technology, applied to the most ubiquitous business tool in the WORLD!!! I personally would say that this is the best thing to happen to Excel, since Excel!
results.name: Business Intelligence with PowerPivot and DAX

Women want to be in business for ourselves but not to be in business by ourselves. Successful women don't come from working smarter or harder, they come from belonging to a global network of women, all dedicated to conducting business from the heart. As women we understand the true meaning of service and that gives us a great advantage in an economy where fortunes will be made by people serving other people. If you have the heart to help other woman and are open to the love and support that business women around the world can bring and if you have exhausted all of the traditional possibilities for earning success, please join us to open your heart and open your eyes and see the new business reality unfolding all around you. Expect to receive the respect you deserve for all the incredible service you've done for the people you love; to feel appreciated by other women who have also made great sacrifices and to meet women like you who began practicing our unique approach and they will become your mentors, coaches, your role models and, most importantly, your friends.

results.description:
America's sports and entertainment landscape is more diverse than ever before. Hip hop rivals pop and country music as the most lucrative music forms in world. Spanish language radio and TV ratings out-perform its English language counterparts in many of the largest media markets. The NFL, MLB and NBA each have various ethnic and racial groups highly represented on the field or on the court.

Yet the staffs and front offices of these venues, teams and promoters don't always reflect the diversity on the field, on the stage or in the stands. The Institute for Diversity and Inclusion in Sport reports that the NBA's player population stands at 81 percent men of color yet only 7 percent of team CEOs are Black, Latino or Asian American. In music, three of the top-grossing concert artists are Jay Z, Beyonce and Bruno Mars but what percentage of the arena's sales and marketing staff are people of color? When working at a venue or with a promoter, how do you connect with industry colleagues and other resources to help you market and sell more tickets to diversity markets?

Our group seeks to to do three, fun things to help:

1. Network! We have a network of sports and entertainment sales, marketing, PR and venue operations professionals that would love to get together and network and make new connections. We also know lots of people would like to explore getting a job with a sports team or a art house venue but don't have the knowledge or the connections. We could be a fun group to learn more and make those connections.

2. Attend Live Events & Meet Insiders. We also look to schedule outings where we can to see a great show or sporting event but get something a little extra - like see a show then have an artist meet-and-greet or attend a sporting event and then meet current team employees to learn about the industry. There are lots of great opportunities for these kinds of outings throughout the NY/NJ region.

 3. Have Fun! That's why we don't sell or market something boring, after all :) We hope you can join us for some fun outings with like-minded professionals.
results.name: Dahday's Live Sports & Entertainment Industry Insiders Group

results.description:
The law uses reason in language for social good. That will never change. 

We are a collection of Lawyers, Cognitive Scientists, and AI Programmers focused on applying both manual and automated cognitive systems to all aspects of the legal profession. Modern Cognitive Science uses quantitative methods to better understand language use, reason development, and human behavior. Heretofore, the legal profession has engineered a cogent "case" before a judge and jury. These seem to be two sides of the same coin: one quantative and the other intuitive.

In our monthly meetings, held physical in NYC and cyber presented into the USA, we compare and contrast the empirical method of Cognitive Science to the intuitive skills of a well trained legal mind.

If you feel the findings in Cognitive Science now has application to the legal profession, please phone or drop in.

The Organizers.
results.name: Cognitive Lawyers

results.description:
Lesson one - Every sales pitch, whether your selling a washing machine, or your latest work of fiction, should include a call to action with a benefit.

Welcome to JMFNJFWGHM aka, the group with no hope of a memorable acronym. This is a mastermind group for people interested in the art and business of fiction writing. Our motto - "when one boat rises, all boats rise." 

Below is some basic information. Please visit the various other sections of our site for more details.


Our Goals

Ours is not your typical meetup group. Our primary focus is to help writers at all levels of development, to evolve and improve both their skills as a writer, and their knowledge  and abilities in aspects of self-publishing. We do this by pursuing four goals.

Goal 1 - To Sharpen our writing skills through discussions of craft and technique, by performing fun group writing exercises, and by critiquing each others work in a structured format.

Goal 2 - To add to our knowledge of the  craft and business of writing, through the selected readings of some of the best books on the market. Each month our group will read one book from a list of selected titles. What we learn from each book, will be the basis of our discussions as we share ideas and experiences, building on the material we've read.

Goal 3 - To explore the rapidly grow opportunities arising from the world of self-publishing through discussion and sharing of experiences and ideas. Building mailing lists, construction of marketing funnels, building product catalogs, calls to action, e-book pricing, hybrid publishing, paper print vs digital - all these subjects and more will be examined.

Goal 4 - To network with like minded writers, to share ideas, to encourage, to mastermind. Writing can be a lonely pursuit. It often helps to get together with those walking the same path as you. As the group grows and gets comfortable with each other, additional gatherings may be arranged, from an occasional get together over a few drinks or a cup of coffee, to going as a group to a writers conference (RWA 2015!).


Who This Group Is For

This group is primarily for story tellers, writers of fiction and memoirs. While all writers within these categories are welcome, it should be noted that this group will be especially geared towards the entrepreneur, the person(s) looking to write professionally, or at least make some supplemental income. Self-publishing will also have a strong focus, though we will also touch on traditional and hybrid publishing during the course of our journey. Existing professional writers are more than welcome (we will worship you accordingly), as are beginners and everyone in-between who have finally decided its time to pursue that dream.

The group is length agnostic - short stories, novella's, novels, serials, all are welcome. The group is also genre agnostic. Whether your writing westerns, science fiction or romance, the crafting of story shares the same techniques and difficulties.


Which is Why ...

Writing groups are notoriously tough to start and maintain on meetup.com. With your help, we're going to be different. While we appreciate you joining our little "kickass" group, "just joining" and three dollars will help pay for coffee. SHOWING UP to a meeting is what really counts! Come to a meeting. You will have fun, sharpen your skills and learn tons of valuable stuff.

Lesson two - start with a call to action, then end with a call to action. See you at the next meeting:)
results.name: Join The Fun North Jersey Fiction Writers Group, He Marketed

We are looking for fashionable, amazing bloggers and business owners to represent the DMV and equally fashion savvy and creative bloggers and business owners to rep for NYC. We’ll connect the two cities via blog collaborations, networking and socializing. And of course, there will be events, virtual and live, so we can get to know one another (being part of this Meet-Up, you will gain a sisterhood/brotherhood).

You must have a genuine, positive attitude, and be willing to work with other entrepreneurs in ways that are mutually beneficial because that is what the group is all about! We are planning tons of events at great venues. This group is for all Fashion Bloggers from the DMV and New York City area (all boroughs and counties are WELCOME).

Small business owners focused plus size fashion, design, jewelry or accessories are also welcome. If you are a fashion/lifestyle blogger, boutique owner based in the DMV or NYC this meetup group is for you!!!

For Membership Consideration:

Must have been blogging for 4 Months+

Must have a FASHION or LIFESTYLE blog catering to the plus size and curvy community

Must apply with a meetup group photo

Must fill out the questions in Full

Must include a link to your blog

For professional reasons we do NOT accept members who are owners/founders of PR Firms, Social Media and Marketing Firms and the like, but we do work/collaborate with people in those positions.

results.description:
Meet your new crew. <br>

<br>

Take out a piece of paper, number it 1 through 10 and list the things you want to do before you die. From bushwhacking our way through hiking trails to hang gliding, stand up paddleboarding, and spelunking, we also love our hot pot, twisted card games, and epic karaoke backup dancing. Some things you just can't unsee. So come out, meet some new people, and let's start adventuring.

<br>

Also if you want to host an event, just let us know! We're just a bunch of friends hanging out, nothing too formal :p

<br>

1) Flakers be warned, don't flake! Or else the typical tarring and feathering, pointing and laughing, at risk for being banned for life kinda deal. Unless maybe you bribe us with food and alcohol. We like food and alcohol. 

<br>

2) We operate by carpool unless otherwise specified. Any volunteers are greatly appreciated!

<br>

3) For events, you are responsible for buying your own tickets. If you can't make something, you take that hit.

4) We are hardcore! lol but seriously some of this stuff is "dangerous" or "life threatening". By joining the group you acknowledge that anything you do is at your own risk and everyone is responsible for themselves, AKA we are not liable. 

<br>

5) Have fun! And smile! You are so much hotter that way!

<br>

results.description:
Grab A Girlfriend and Go is a meet-up for positive, powerful, success-minded, women who are stepping into their greatness, activating their power and showing up for their lives in a bigger and bolder way. Don't miss the shift!

Can you honestly say that you are living the life of your dreams? Or do you sometimes feel like you are not living up to your full potential and life is passing you by? Do you have big dreams and great ideas locked inside and you want to unleash them in order to take your life to the next level?

If the answer is yes, you've come to the right meetup, because this meet-up was created just for women like you. You will be challenge to go beyond where you are today and step into your best life ever. Together, we will push pass the fears, silence the voice of self-doubt and replace them with unshakeable confidence, powerful habits and a clear deliberate plan for success. You'll be encouraged and inspired to go beyond the woman you are today, so that you can activate your extraordinary life. It doesn't matter where you’ve been, what you’ve gone through, how many hurdles you had to climb to get here... from this moment on, it's all about creating the extraordinary, fabulous life you deserve.

Use the gatherings, classes tools and resources in this meet-up to begin your journey towards a bigger and better life. I'll be with you every step of the way coaching you and cheering you on. And more importantly, you’ll be around other positive, like-minded women who will be rooting for you to win.

Getting to the next level of your life as a lone wolf can be daunting, but when you Grab A Girlfriend and Go, you harness the positive energy of like-minded women as well as the power of community and you realize that you don’t have to do it alone.

Come ready with a notebook, a desire to show up in a bigger and better way and a teachable spirit as these meet-ups are filled with lots of content and practical action steps!

Can't Wait To Meet You,

Cassandra Mack

www.strategiesforempoweredliving.com

www.facebook.com/GrabAGirlfriendandGo

http://grabagirlfriendandgo.blogspot.com/
results.name: Grab A Girlfriend & Go Be Unstoppable Meetup Group

We introduce simple techniques you've probably never seen or heard about before that will help you to naturally play your best more often and have more fun. Our focus is on the mental game and the mind-body connection that's 'really' in charge of how well you play. You'll be amazed at how easy it is to Play Better Golf Now!

 
We'll show you how unwanted thoughts (even unconscious ones!) and stressful emotions get in your way and help you fix this once and for all. You will even learn how to help yourself eliminate painful restrictions in your golf swing movements and improve your range of motion.


If this seems all too good to be true then come out for one of our free introductory seminars and see for yourself how these simple techniques can truly help you play better golf now. If you don't see a meetup time that works for you then let us know so we can organize one for your club or group.
