results.description:
Dharma Voices for Animals (DVA) is an organization of those committed both to practicing the teachings of the Buddha (the Dharma) and to speaking out when animal suffering is supported by the actions of those in Dharma communities and by the policies of Dharma centers. We want to be the voice of the animals who cannot speak our language and are unable to ask, “Why are you paying people to do this to me?” or “Why are you supporting my suffering?” We want to support those who are willing to speak out about the harm we cause other sentient beings when we eat them, use their body parts as clothing and in other ways, or use household and personal hygiene products that are tested on animals. While DVA recognizes the challenges of living in a complex, modern society, we wish to promote the choices that provide the greatest reduction of animal suffering. It is our intention to be inclusive in honoring the different views of those who sincerely intend to minimize the suffering of animals.

You are welcome to attend a variety of events when you join the DVA New York Chapter meetup.  In addition to this group we invite you to support our efforts by visiting the website:

http://dharmavoicesforanimals.org/

May all living beings be happy and free!


Our Leadership Team:

Bob Isaacson is the President of Dharma Voices for Animals.  He has practiced the Dharma for nineteen years in the Vipassana/Theravada tradition, and taught numerous classes and retreats.   Bob is also a former human rights and civil rights attorney.  He enjoys hiking, biking, swimming, and world travel.

Kamil Ghoshal is the DVA New York Chapter Leader and dedicated Eight-Precept (aṭṭha-sīla) Theravādin disciple (upāsaka) at the Original Buddhism Society.  He is an aspiring Buddhist scholar with background in Western Philosophy.  Kamil's mission outside of DVA is to help restore the original presectarian Teachings of the historical Buddha, Siddhāttha Gotama.  He is also a mountaineer and traditional Chinese kung-fu practitioner.
results.name: Dharma Voices for Animals - New York Chapter

results.description:
This group is here to connect you to other tennis players that play on a similar skill level and live close enough to get a match in, even with your busy schedule.

This is not a group for finding personal lessons or instructors, it's a group for people that are looking for a good singles or doubles match up. How this works:

1. Create or Join a Meetup: Specify if looking for doubles/singles and your skill level (see below)
2. Once you have enough people for a game, coordinate with them on time, location, and court reservations 

Your next move: Use the message board and meetup schedule to find match-ups near you!

Need your help: Please message me if you want to be able to post Meetups, and I can grant you that access.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Skill Levels:


1.0: This player is Just starting to play tennis.

1.5: Has limited experience and is still working primarily on getting the ball into play.

2.0: Has obvious stroke weaknesses but is familiar with basic positions for singles and doubles play.

2.5: Can sustain a short rally of slow pace with other players of the same ability.

3.0: Fairly consistent when hitting medium-paced shots, but is not comfortable with all strokes and lacks execution when trying for directional control, depth or power.

3.5: Has achieved improved stroke dependability with directional control on moderate shots, but still lacks depth and variety. Starting to exhibit more aggressive net play.

4.0: Has dependable strokes, including directional control and depth on both forehand and backhand sides on moderate shots, plus the ability to use lobs, overheads, approach shots and volleys with some success.

4.5: Starting to master the use of power and spins and beginning to handle pace, has sound footwork, can control depth of shots and is beginning to vary game plan according to opponents.

5.0: Has good shot anticipation and frequently has an outstanding shot or exceptional consistency around which a game may be structured.

5.5: Can vary strategies and styles of play in a competitive situation and hit dependable shots in a stress situation.

6.0: has obtained a sectional and /or national ranking.

6.5: has extensive satellite tournament experience.

7.0: makes his living from tournament prize money.


-----------------------------------------------------------------
New York City Courts:

Central Park: Central Park 93d St. near West Drive

Brian Watkins Tennis Center: East River Park, At Houston St. (walk east over FDR Drive)

Washington Market Park: Chambers St. & West St.

Hudson River Park: Near W 10th St on the Hudson River

topics.name: Studying for the Graduate Record Exam

results.description:
Do you need to refresh your math for college algebra, the GRE, the GMAT, or just for work and life? Are you going back to school after years in the working world?

I'm here to help! This group meets Sundays at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St). Each 1.5 hour session includes some of the following topics:

Algebra
Word Problems
Elementary Number Theory (Odds, Evens, Primes)
Probability
Geometry
Fractions, Decimals, Repeating Decimals
Percents and Compound Interest This is not a test prep class, but would be very effective if taken concurrently with a test prep class, or prior to beginning your GRE/GMAT studies. (You may also be interested in my other Meetup groups, Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura and Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am author, co-author, or editor of many test prep books covering math, vocabulary, grammar, logic, and more. I have developed a series of seminars on "Intellectual Performance Enhancement," covering topics from test stress to the inferential logic common to both verbal reasoning and math problems. I have perfect scores on the GRE and SAT, and a 780 on the GMAT (including perfect 51Q). More importantly, I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly (especially to people who have "math terror"), and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: College Algebra / High School Math Refresher with Jen Dziura

NY Area Managers Meetup is an ideal opportunity for the current and/or future aspiring hotel managers to network, grow their hotel's revenue and advance careers. Hospitality Industry is a networking business. Join your professional colleagues, grow your business and advance your career. 

Who Should Join?
Current and future hotel managers.

Why Should Members Join?
Hotel business is a networking business. We network for more business and network to advance our careers. Joining the Forum Meetup group is a perfect opportunity helping to achieve both objectives.

results.description:
"NETWORKING is the single most powerful marketing tactic to accelerate and sustain success for any individual or organization!" – Adam Small 

Why do I need to network?

1. As entrepreneurs and professionals, it is imperative that we stay around like minded individuals. Relationships are the catalyst for success. 

2. In this ever so growing competitive job market, you will quickly learn that it is not always what you know, but who do you know.

3. You never know what personal connection or business deal is hidden in a little conversation. 

4. If you are seasoned, you can meet a young pup with a lot of pep to do heavy lifting for you.

5. If you are new, you can meet an expert in your field and skip a lot of mistakes just by listening to their experiences. 

What makes us different?

1.Here at the NJ Networking Circle we like to keep things fun and innovative, even for the shy and timid. What better way is there to wind down a hard work week then with a little professional party and networking. We like to consider ourselves the transition group because we are not in an up tight work atmosphere, nor is it a full blown out night at the club. You can consider it to be either the cool down of a long week or the warm up to a great weekend; the choice is yours. We just want you to take a load off and have a great time meeting great people. 

2.We will give small trainings on how to network as well as business tips.

3.Guest speakers will be booked. Usually local entrepreneurs and professionals who have success and can offer useful advice. 

4. We encourage members to make long lasting connection by helping them to find accountability partners. These are the people that will keep us on track and hold us accountable for the goals that we set.
results.name: NJ Entrepreneur and Professional Networking Circle

results.description:
A small group of geologists, earth science teachers, students and hobbyists organized the SIGS in 1972 to stimulate interest in mineralogy, geology, paleontology, and the lapidary arts.  The Society has broad activities designed for everyone from beginners to professionals. These activities include illustrated presentations on a wide range of earth science topics, participation in gem and mineral shows and field trips to available collecting areas, both here and in other states. The informal social environment of the Society holds the interest of all ages from the youngest to the oldest. The general meetings are free and open to all who wish to attend. We are also affiliated with the Eastern Federation of Mineralogical and Lapidary Societies (EFMLS) and the American Federation of Mineralogical Societies (AFMS). Meetings are held on the second Friday of the month (September to June) at 7:30 P.M. in the basement meeting room of the Father Hicks Center, St. Clare's School, Lindenwood Road entrance, Great Kills, Staten Island. At each meeting, a speaker presents a talk on their specialized field. Some are skilled hobbyists and others well-known professionals, but all of them bring their specialties to us for our enjoyment.

In order to participate in SIGS field trips, you must be a member in good standing, as our liability insurance will cover you not only to and from the field trips but to and from our meetings on Staten Island, New York as well.
results.name: Staten Island Geological Society Inc.

topics.name: "Cloud Computing" How to use it for your business

results.description:
Today's corporate officers and IT technologists are literally deluged with marketing hype over cloud, and the economic advantages of migrating business and IT functions and applications to the cloud. 
• We have seen corporate giants like NetFlix and Sabre (global reservation system used by major airline carriers) experience cloud-based system outages, causing customer delays and significantly impacting business not just in the US, but impacted globally in the case of Sabre.
• There are hundreds of cloud providers to choose from in the market today. Not all are enterprise ready, despite their claims. And let's face it, many have paid or biased positioning in leading independent studies released by highly respected IT research companies. 
• How does a CIO or CTO, and today's CEO, tasked to identify the essential drivers of a business, navigate? Leading independent think tanks (Gartner, Aberdeen, IDC, etc) are not fully equipped to provide battle-tested and deep thorough analysis regarding the critical issues of cloud security, network throughput, reliability and ROI when it comes to enterprise grade customers. Researchers can only convey what they read and disseminate their opinions, not facts. Gartner even has in its disclaimer that all analysis is "opinion and not based on facts." 
• It's time that we get real answers and share actual experiences from companies who are using enterprise grade cloud and from true technologists that has the experience and credentials to provide an unbiased roadmap. 
• GOAL: We create leaner, more efficient companies that is secure, reliable and has the ROI to start training our current employees, and bringing jobs back to the US workforce.
results.name: New York Cloud Computing Meetup

results.description:
We, the organizers of the New York Asian writers Meetup have noticed that many of the language exchange and assistance programs in New York catering to Asians have been based in Manhattan despite that many of the attendees hail from Queens. In addition, we have noticed that most of the language assistance content has been focused on oral communication and reading of non-fiction/short articles in English.

 The organizers of this new meetup hope to bring back the meetings to the local community: Queens. In addition to English speaking and language and cultural exchange, we will also be focusing on writing--both academic and creative (pros/poetry) as well as reading fiction, non-fiction, short essays, articles, excerpts from books, and poems every two weeks. Hopefully, the readings will spark discussion about themes, concepts, ideas and issues relevant the Asia diaspora; Asian American; Pacific Islander and immigrant experience.

 Our target audience is those of Asian descent in NY (Manhattan, Queens, LI, Brooklyn, Staten Island, Bronx, and Queens). Book lovers, writers, and students are encouraged to join our meetings. Whether you are a novice writer, who needs feedback, criticism, or even proof-reading; or an accomplished writer, who would like to see how your writing will be accepted by the public and how people will be impacted by your writing; or a student working on a research paper for school; in all cases, we encourage you to submit your writing and join our meet-up group. Hopefully, these original pieces will also stimulate discussion relevant to diverse Asian communities in NY and the immigrant and international experience that is NYC.

All sorts of writing are encouraged: short stories, poems, articles or essays. There will also be opportunities for peer-to-peer proofreading and also sharing your original writings with the group. There also maybe workshops on how to advance your research skills using our American library system.

 And, finally, we hope to include events and activities that will allow our members to explore the city and get to know each other better. Events such as book readings and signings, dinners, or events at the Asian American Writers Workshop, or visits to interesting but obscure used bookstores, will be included. Our Meetups will be in warm environments like city parks or cafes in Queens. Since we are new, we may change the format as we cater to the ever changing needs of our members.

Important:

 When submitting request to join please upload a real picture of yourself - otherwise your membership will be rejected. Please join us!
results.name: New York English Language Exchange & Asian Writers Meetup

results.description:
The GIFTS (GLBTQ in Fellowship, Tradition and Service) Fellowship is a LGBTQ community of faith, a vital part of Marble Collegiate Church. GIFTS works to co-create with God, a world in which people of all sexual orientations and gender identities are embraced as God’s beloved children, a world in which each of us know ourselves to be created in God’s image, gifted and unique. Marble Collegiate Church has been welcoming and affirming of LGBTQ people since 1992, when a small group of gay men who were a part of the Marble community formed GIFTS. We hope you will join us in creating this world through one of our programs and activities!

Marble Collegiate Church is a diverse, inclusive community of God’s people whose faith is led by the life and teachings of Jesus Christ. We welcome, love and empower all persons to become positive thinkers, filled with hope, making a difference in the world. Marble Church is a welcoming and affirming congregation, and worships in the tradition of the Reformed Church in America (formerly Dutch Reformed). 

For more information about the GIFTS Fellowship, its programs and events, or Marble Collegiate Church, please visit us at www.MarbleChurch.org, email us at GIFTS@MarbleChurch.org or call us at 212.686.2770 x260.

Find us on Facebook!

results.description:
This is about getting the best Russian spa / sauna treatments in a group of fun people. We plan to have Aromatherapy, Platza (traditional leaves massage) treatment and a lesson, salt scrub, honey mask and more.

If you are a veteran banya-goer who knows how to enjoy steam room and saunas or just want a little adventure trying something uniquely Russian right here in the heart of the city, join us for this experience. Russian baths are tricky to explore on your own (venik technique anyone?) and are best to be done in the mix of experts and neophytes. Lets meet together in one of the Russian baths, learn from each other and enjoy all the banyas have to offer.

Baths events are often associated with gay hookups. While nothing against it in general, don't get confused, this is NOT such an event.
results.name: NYC Russian Baths (Banya) sauna meetup

results.description:
Want to lean more about photography from fun, friendly, and professional photography instructors? Want to meet new people, take great photos, and have a ton of fun at the same time? New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops is the group for you!

Our fun and friendly photography group offers classes for all levels of photographers - from the novice who just bought their first camera and can't find the power button, to the seasoned pro who wants to hone their skills and meet new people.   

All of our classes are organized by Remember Forever Photography and include professional instruction from our veteran photographers, and a free course workbook with notes and lessons from class. Best of all, when you sign up through Meetup, all of our classes are half off the retail price!

So grab your camera and bring some friends for a fun and memorable photo experience! We have 5 star reviews on Yelp, Tripadvisor and Travelzoo! Check out our website as well at www.rememberforever.co

Frequently Asked Questions

1.  Help! I can't find my instructor/don't know where we're meeting!

After you sign up for one of our Meetups, you should shortly receive an email from Remember Forever Photography with directions to your meeting spot and contact information for your instructor for the day.  If you don't receive an email from us, give our business office a call at 646.736.3231 and we'll be happy to put you in touch with your instructor, or send you another copy of your confirmation email. Most of our instructors also have the Meetup.com app, so you can send them a direct message as well if you need to.


2. Can I just pay you in cash when I get to class?

Unfortunately, we can't accept cash for tax purposes. Sorry! Most of our instructors can process credit cards on site, but we really appreciate it if you sign up through Meetup first so we get an accurate headcount on who's coming to class.


3. What do I do if it's raining/snowing/hurricaning on the day of my Meetup?

We'll notify everyone by email as soon as possible if we feel we need to cancel a Meetup due to the weather.  If we do need to cancel, we'll automatically reschedule you to the next available Meetup or any Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value.  Check out each individual Meetup for for more info on our refund policy. 


4. Why do you need at least two students enrolled to run a Meetup? And what happens if we don't get enough students signed up. 

Having at least two students per Meetup ensures that we cover the cost of liability insurance for our students and also ensures we can pay our awesome staff photographers a fair wage. 

If we don't have enough students to run a Meetup, we'll notify you as soon as possible and get you signed up for the next available Meetup, or any other Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value. 


5.  I don't see any other students signed up.  Does this mean my Meetup is canceled?

Maybe not! We get students signing up for our courses from several sources in addition to our Meetup group. Unless we notify you otherwise, we more than likely have enough students enrolled to run as scheduled.


Still have questions? Feel free to give us a call at 646.736.3231 or drop us an email at info@rememberforever.co
results.name: New York Beginner to Advanced Photography Workshops

results.description:
At Adventure Nuts we seek the new and unexpected.  We are a tribe of Explorers ready to learn, share and inspire one another through a variety of activities ranging from arts and culture to spiritual awakenings to fitness challenges and everything in between.

Adventure Nuts is primarily funded by Explorer donations and are used to organize and coordinate fun
adventures. We take the interests of our Explorers very seriously and consider their needs, wants and desires when planning the next event. No donation is too big or too small.

At Adventure Nuts we have three core values:

Comradery. We are all explorers part of one tribe. We are all unique and nuts about something. Form a comradely, and get to know the people around you. You will find out that you share more in common than you think!

Be open. This is your time to let go, learn something new, meet new explorers, and inspire one another. You will find that when you embark on an adventure you put your adult responsibilities on hold, and enter into the world of fun and play.

Be curious. Ask questions, share your expertise, and lets all explore together.

Adventure Nuts was started by two friends looking to change the world one adventure at a time. Together we hope to build a tribe of explorers who can learn, share, and inspire one another.
results.name: Adventure Nuts

results.description:
This group is about photographers and models who are from all levels of experience, who are looking to collaborate together to produce some fantastic images.  We are now expanded to MUA's and fashion designers, and hair stylists to make the creative experience a more rewarding one.  Our group will meet once to twice a month; I also run another meet-up group and want to dedicate enough time to both groups.  

The idea is our model members will participate for themed shoots; have their makeup done by our MUA's  while our photographer members will photograph them.  All parties will learn from one another, resulting in some fun diversified images.  We will try our best to match the number of photographers to each model and every model will have the opportunity to get photographed.  Our activities will be non-paying for all sides, but the experience is very rewarding.

[In cases where we do not have model members to model for us, we will have the option of recruiting outside models, which may require $20 per person.  I will do my best to keep that cost as low as possible.]

• Please post your images in a prompt manner and forward a minimum of 5 images so that our model members, and Makeup artists could keep or add to their portfolios. Photographers have one week from the date of our event to to edit and process their pics to be forwarded to each model and makeup artist.  Unless otherwise specified by the Organizers, (Failure to do so, means that you aren't in compliance to our group rules which isn't fair to our models or MUA's and interferes with our exchange.  As a result you will be asked to leave our group, serious artists are required here.). 

 I recommend placing watermarks on all your creative works.  Release forms will be given out to protect the creative works of the photographer and to ensure 5 images for our models and MUA's. (NO OUTSIDE RELEASE FORMS ALLOWED!!!!)

I welcome ideas for great convenient locations where we can take our photographs.   Together we can build up our portfolio's for creative growth and new possibilities.  Our past events have topped the next, and keeping this momentum requires serious artists, and creativity. 

Disclaimer: be mindful of the risks of the weather and travels, all participation is at your own risk.   It is your responsibility to stay up to date with travel changes or delays.  But when I can I will post necessary info. as they become available.

results.description:
GDG Newark was started in 2012 to host a Google I/O Extended. We have recently moved to meetup.com to expand our groups visibility. We currently focus on the Android mobile platform. If you're interested in other Google technologies please join our group and consider hosting a session. 

To visit this page directly just visit GDGNJ.org

Our meetings will always be free and open to the general public. These events will be hosted at the New Jersey Institute of Technology. Surrounded by other colleges and a quick train ride away from Newark Penn Station. 

Disclaimer: GDG New Jersey is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed on here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. What is a GDG (As defined by Google)? Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are for developers who are interested in Google's developer technology; everything from the Android, App Engine, and Google Chrome platforms, to product APIs like the Maps API,YouTube API and Google Calendar API. A GDG can take many forms -- from just a few people getting together to watch our latest video, to large gatherings with demos and tech talks, to events like code sprints and hackathons. However, at the core, GDGs are focused on developers and technical content, and the core audience should be developers.

results.description:
Q:   Do you like to stay well-informed on the current events, and enjoy reading and discussing various topics for intellectual stimulation?

A:   Well, you've come to the right place!

The premise is simple: We get together each month and discuss something interesting based on what the members find compelling in a news article, video segment, or audio program.  The topics can range from the serious to the inane, but we strive to discuss something that has enriching coverage and deep analysis.  Click here to see a sample of our favorite, but non-exhaustive sources.

Our goal is to provide a friendly forum for people to come in person, sit down at a table for about two hours, and exchange views and discuss ideas over coffee or whatever beverage of their own choosing.  The organizers will keep the discussions open and moving. 

We try to keep meetup sizes relatively small to allow participation and interaction, keeping in mind what the venue will allow. Members can sign up for the waitlist if all the spots fill up. As people with RSVPs cancel, waitlisted members will be moved onto the RSVP list. Organizers will try to reasonably accommodate longstanding members who've had good past attendance as well as members who contribute by the way of an article suggestion or thoughtful comment.

How it works: Each meeting organizers select a theme and an article to go along with it. Members nominate and vote on a second article. Attending members of a meeting are expected to come prepared for discussion by having read both articles.

To encourage members to arrive early so meetings can end on time, we offer a pre-meeting topic. Usually a lighter discussion based on more immediate events. There may be an article attached, but reading of it is not required.

Join us, as we share thoughtful discussions on the topics that interest everyone!
results.name: Café News

In the end, it's not going to matter how many breaths you took, but how many moments took your breath away. So join Us and lets have some FUN! Hopefully see you soon,

Thanks, Robert

results.description:
This is a group for Progressive Muslims in their 20's or 30's looking to meet each other in NY, having light friendly conversation, socializing and connecting. We plan to meet at different venues in NYC, eat out, picnics,day trips, night outs and other adventures. We want to create a meet up for young, active and modern Muslims whether singles, couples or young families who enjoy brunching, dining, sports, outdoor adventures and some nightlife. Please note this is not a religious,social or political discussion group. In fact we will steer clear from such topics and enjoy good company. Non Muslims who fit this profile are welcome to join us as well. 

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending which is only fair considering there is no membership fee for this group and we do not charge event fees either.

Please link the meet up group to an active email ID so emails and messages reach you in timely manner. This group is for ACTIVE members only. INACTIVE members will be removed from group and are welcome to re-join when they are able to participate more actively. ACTIVE members are requested to make an effort to participate in any one event at least once in a year from their date of joining to retain their membership. Our efforts are to create a compact, dynamic group and you should have the time and inclination to attend events. 

Profile picture must include your photo, membership will be declined if anything else is displayed. 

Meetup messaging is an important communication tool for this group, please ensure you are able to access and respond to messages sent by organizers. To access and reply to your messages click on the dialogue icon in top right corner with desktop view of this site or on the dialogue icon at the bottom in the meetup app. We have formed some good friendships in this group. If you want to connect with other members please join us for events. Inappropriate messages and behavior will not be tolerated and such members will be removed from group.

Organizing takes lot of time and effort and therefore we place high premium on members attending events as RSVP'd. Our organizers are offering to organize/host events in their spare time and are equally busy in their lives/careers, so we want to make this a smooth process for everyone. Request all members to note below rules of the group and take a moment before you RSVP. Treat these events as other social events where you are a guest and extend courtesy to the host/event organizer by RSVP'ing carefully. Thank you.

No need to RSVP NO if you are not attending, unless you are changing your RSVP from YES to NO.

RSVP YES to events only if you are 100% committed to attending. RSVP's will be considered FINAL 48 hrs prior to the event, last minute change allowed in certain unavoidable circumstances. Remember that waitlisted members deserve fair opportunity to attend.

Certain premium reserved events as indicated on the event write up will only have Final RSVP, in other words it will be considered no show if you change from YES to NO. 

No shows (members who RSVP YES and do not show up for the event without notice) will be removed from the group and banned from re-joining.

RSVP changes on day of event will not be tolerated with some understandable and reasonable exceptions.

Habitual RSVP changers (members who repeatedly RSVP Yes and change to NO) will be moved to waitlist by default. They may also be charged a meetup fee in advance for attending future events.

Please try to arrive on time for events and use MTA trip planner tool which is useful if you are using public transit for directions, transit changes during weekend and timings.

http://tripplanner.mta.info/mobile/

Feel free to contact with any suggestions for events that you may like to attend or host.

This group is dedicated to helping the solo/small business owner develop his market, brand, communication, etc. 

Have you read a book, taken a class, seen a coach, followed their advice and come up with something that seems great, but there is no way to get feedback without spending a ton of money for more coaching, more classes, etc. that you can't afford?

It happened to me a while back.  I took a great course, but the promised support and feedback wasn't there, and to get feedback and the great ideas I came up with, would have cost me hundreds or thousands of dollars.  Instead of spending all that money, I thought, I could find a group of smart people who could help each other.

If you are interested in getting some feedback for your great ideas?  If you are looking for resources and recommendations?  Join us!

We will meet regularly to brainstorm and exchange ideas how to build our business and to provide support and feedback to each other.  We will explore bringing in coaches and experts to help teach us, and when we do, we can use the Mastermind group to refine what we've learned.

results.description:
The mission : To raise the collective consciousness of our people, by making available information, resources and mentorships that they may or may not have in their individual networks. If you believe , as we do, that the innumerable challenges that people of color face, have created a fracturing of connectivity and mentorship so vital to our community , then this meetup is for you. The world today is ripe with opportunities for all people and this group wants to make sure our participation is equitable. 

The How:

1)we  will meet with  and celebrate those among us who have achieved great things (thought leaders, authors, educators, professionals and everyday folks) to share in their wisdom on how they've done it-and how we can too. 

2) we are creating a revolutionary mentoring system to help us bring each other along faster. 

COME JOIN THE MOVEMENT! Let's get back to being the village that loves and cares for one another! 

P.S. We will have some fun too!

results.description:
Welcome!

Converged Infrastructure New York City group (CINYC) is a forum for gaining awareness and exchanging ideas around practical benefits of convergence of business and technology.  Each one of us is, in some way, focused on bridging the gap between business requirements and the properly structured set of technologies to address such requirements.   We are sensitive to the dichotomy that often exists between various groups in large organizations and we are passionate about taking a collaborative approach to closing such gaps.  We are here to learn, to help each other recognize and reap rewards promised by convergence of infrastructure - a relatively new trend focused on lowering the cost of operating cloud environments by engineering and packaging technology stacks.

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Converged_infrastructure

We exist to help facilitate meetups where professionals & end-users can share best practices for valuing, deploying and operating CI technologies.  Professionals and experts can become aware of new market needs, and new users can gain practical knowledge, expand their foundations about market trends; everyone can grow their professional network. The collaborative cross-organizational approach to implementing CI and harnessing its benefits encourages sharing of ideas, giving rise to sharing best practices - for everyone’s benefit.

Join us if your areas of interest include business transformation, DevOps, use-cases, lessons learned as part of improved organizational re-alignment, as well as intersections of economics and technology.   We expect to have a good mix of technical and business topics and, naturally, welcome speakers and practitioners.
results.name: Converged Infrastructure NYC

results.description:
Circling is the art of presence and co-discovering our deepest selves in community with each other “in the moment”.

 It’s a practice that allows you to enliven, deepen and richen conversations into experiences of profound empathy and insight. 

It’s a practice that naturally has you building skills in connecting, communication, conflict resolution and understanding others. 

It’s a practice that supports the development of genuine curiosity and appreciation for yourself and others. 

What it looks like is a group of people in a circle with their open, curious attention on one individual “getting circled”. Their intention is to “be with” and “understand” what’s happening for this individual moment by moment as “whatever is happening arises”.

The results, in my experience, are profound visceral connection and a quality of conversation that has people moved, inspired and nourished. In my experience, it also results in a much greater awareness of oneself and others. 

This is a meetup group for those interested in developing skills around or experiencing any of what they read above. 

Members can expect to learn the basics of Circling and to participate in two circles every meet up.
results.name: New York Circling Meetup Group

results.description:
As stutterers, we know how tempting it can be to isolate ourselves from the chaos of city life. We know the fear that bubbles up every time we're asked our name, or need help finding an address, ordering food, or even just meeting an old friend. We go to therapy- some of us for years- spending hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars- trying to free our words. 

Even with every physical skill in the book at our disposal, however,  something's missing.  We're still not convinced we have a right to share, loud and clear, the stories, opinions, and quirks that make us who we are. That's because the key to a full life isn't in the hour-a -week spent in the clinic support group, trying to pour your heart out in the three minutes you have before someone starts getting antsy. Talking about what's going on inside certainly has its place in the therapy process, but lasting change can only come from living loudly- actually going out into the world and communicating, on a regular basis.

That's why I (we ) started NYFS. We're planning on regular ( once a week to two weeks) meetups- some just to hang out, and some structured in such a way that we each face a particular type of communication challenge, with the support of the group behind us. This desensitizes us to the fear of disfluent speech,; the fear of being different.

Examples include:

• Going into a department store and asking where you might find the dinner plates

•  Asking a bus driver for directions as people are getting on ( to help experience time pressure)

•  Placing complicated pizza orders over the phone.

•  Talking to a member of the opposite ( or same) sex that you'd like to get to know better, romantically or otherwise

• Talking to a stranger in the park about what you're doing and what stuttering is exactly ( you'd be surprised at how receptive most people are to it!)

Now, we know that everyone is in a different place with their stuttering. That's why, for the first few weeks, we'll be splitting people into groups based on what they're comfortable with- Easy, Medium, and Difficult challenges. I or another group leader will be available to help talk you through what you're feeling beforehand and to offer support, no matter where you're at.


We ARE NOT  licensed speech pathologists, and don't claim to offer therapy. We just know what de-sensitization has done for us and we hope it can do the same for others, when they're surrounded by friends.


Watch this space, message us with any questions you might have and get ready to be fully you!
results.name: Stutter In the City

results.description:
Through a series of workshops you will get an exclusive opportunity to experience a designer's creative process in a hands-on activity. Alyson will explain how that same design process can be applied to everyone's personal and professional lives (even for the so called design-challenged). All people can be designers in their everyday lives; creating each day one by one. Design training can improve how you react to life's surprises by working with your current resources. After a workshop, you will have a new appreciation of design and a new outlook on your life. 

Alyson Toone is the founder and designer for lifestyle brand, Alyson Jon. Life. She designs and creates each piece of handmade jewelry featuring upcycled wares and natural semi-precious stones. Alyson earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts in Fashion Design from Columbus College of Art and Design in her hometown of Columbus, Ohio. She currently resides in Brooklyn where she is constantly inspired and is always learning. By day, she designs outerwear for children in the Garment District and spends her evenings with her brainchild, Alyson Jon. Life. Visit her website here: http://www.alysonjonlife.com

We also visit vendor fairs that bring together online and brick-and-mortar black-owned businesses, along with dining at restaurants from across the diaspora. Occasionally, we even take in a black-created movie, performance or exhibit.  Suggestions are welcome!

Please note our No-Show policy: Please honor your “Yes” RSVPs by attending.  If you’re not able to attend, please be considerate to your fellow group members, the business owners, and me, and update your RSVP at least 1 day before the scheduled start of the meetup.  If you don’t show, or cancel your RSVP the same day of the event 3 times, you’ll be removed from the group.

Be transparent. This group requires a profile photo to join.  If you don't have a photo of yourself in your avatar, I'll ask you to upload one if you've RSVPd for a meetup, at my discretion. I and the other group members like putting a name to a face!
